titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Waldo Huntley Heinrichs Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:05

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, diaries, and photographs document Heinrichs career with the YMCA and his service with the U.S. Air Force. Letters and diaries of Waldo Heinrichs' sister Margaret shed additional light on the period of time that the Heinrichs spent in India 1930-1931. Waldo Heinrichs served as a YMCA secretary in Hawaii, India, and Jerusalem. from 1913 to 1934. He then became Professor of Contemporary Civilization at Middlebury College. He was a pilot for the U.S. Air Force during World War I, and a Combat Intelligence Officer during World War II.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Waldo Huntley Heinrichs Papers (RG 115), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

chronitem.event: Born in British India, son of Jacob and Lydia Heinrichs, American Baptist educational missionaries
B.A., Denison University, Ohio; later received M.A. in European History from Columbia University, New York
First American Y.M.C.A. Secretary to work with British troops in India

First aviation cadet in Army Ground School at M.I.T. Distinguished service with U.S. Army Air Force in Europe. Shot down, severely wounded in September, 1918 and held prisoner until Armistice. Decorated with Croix de Guerre with Palm and other awards.
Head of Lecture Department, National Council of Y.M.C.A.'s of India, Burma, and Ceylon
Associate General Secretary, Y.M.C.A., Lahore, India
Waldo's sister Margaret stayed with the family in India
Professor of Contemporary Civilization, Middlebury College, Middlebury, Vermont
Combat Intelligence Officer in 66th Fighter Wing, VIII Fighter Command of 8th Air Force in England
Professor of Contemporary Civilization, Middlebury College

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

item.ref: VI. Letters and Diaries of Margaret Heinrichs

scopecontent.p: These papers are of interest for their documentation of Heinrichs' work with the YMCA in India and Jerusalem. Complementary papers are located in the YMCA archives at the University of Minnesota. The collection includes twenty-six diary volumes dating from 1909 to 1945, photographs, clippings, and letters, including some related to Heinrichs' YMCA service. He resigned from the YMCA in 1934 following a disagreement with the International Committee concerning Nazi anti-Semitic newspapers in the reading room of the Jerusalem YMCA Heinrichs was a friend of John R. Mott and Sherwood Eddy and twice participated in the Sherwood Eddy Travel Seminar in Europe. These papers are also of interest because Heinrichs was a child of missionaries and spent a good part of his youth separated form his parents. A few letters written later in life to his children explore the implications of his early experience.
The Letters and Diaries of Margaret Heinrichs in Series VI shed additional light on the activities of the Heinrichs family in India during 1930-1931.

list.item: VI. Letters and Diaries of Margaret Heinrichs

did.unittitle: Letters to/from family, including regarding the death of Heinrichs' brother Edgar in 1910, a letter to his wife regarding the Jerusalem YMCA situation in 1934, and letters written from Europe in 1939, which describe the prelude to World War II.
Letters to family enroute to and in France
Letters to family while in France with American Expeditionary Force
Letters to family while in New York
Letter to wife, Dorothy from France
Letters to Dorothy from NYC and London
Letters to Dorothy from England while with 66th Fighter Wing
Adjutant General Office - re. prisoners of war
Memorandum - Report by Harmon on settlement of newspaper controversy in Jerusalem YMCA
"Our Heritage of Freedom" - history of the VIII Fighter Command of the 8th U.S. Army Air Force
Lecture notes re. world situation, foreign policy
Lecture notes of Heinrichs' father Jacob on religions of India
Biographical documentation: re. death of Edgar Heinrichs
Biographical documentation: World War I service
Biographical documentation: YMCA work - India, Jerusalem
Biographical documentation: World War II service
Notebook relating to Waldo Heinrichs Scholarship at Middlebury College
Scrapbook of memorabilia and clippings; Croix de Guerre citation; grammar school and high school diplomas
Photo album of YMCA scout camp in India
Photo album of scenes in India

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are a total of 26 diary volumes, with fairly regular and detailed daily entries. They are of interest for their documentation of Heinrichs' personal life as well as his work overseas.

did.unittitle: Letters and Diaries of Margaret Heinrichs
Letters written to parents while on world tour
Letters to parents from India, Jerusalem, Egypt
Written while sailing Pacific, in Japan, in India, including notes about India and record of expenditures in India
Written from Lahore and on trip back through Europe
Trip to Israel and other locations with parents
